channel.title: Help Pk Shop
channel.description:
Hello Guys...Few days ago i started a server emulous based. its really hard to code and stuff. i need little help adding pk shop..
i already have pk points system.(like when your kill someone in wildy your get 1 pk point)
all i want i a shop that [size=10pt][b]charges pk points[/b][/size] to buy stuff.
just need to know how to make a shop sell stuff for pk points.. tyvm im new at coding

item.title: Help Pk Shop
item.dc:creator: @shoveb1 shoveb1
item.description:
@shoveb1 wrote:

dude its winterlove base.

and no fking help tyvm.

item.title: Help Pk Shop
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:3, topic:341442”]wrong section
and if u can’t figure that out, i suggest NOT USING HYPERION

hyperion isn’t for basic coders, its a packaged source, which means u need at least some normal (NOT BASIC) knowledge of how a server works
also hyperion is a very horrible source to use, sure ppl say its good, but the mina framework in it causes so much jvm usage that it does so much harm to your computer (in my opinion)

but from what i recall from looking at it…

look at
bin -> model -> players (i think, i haven’t looked at the source in a long time, but that’s usually wat packaged servers have it set to)[/quote]

Is emulous hyperion based? I thought it was wL

Read full topic

item.title: Help Pk Shop
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

wrong section
and if u can’t figure that out, i suggest NOT USING HYPERION

hyperion isn’t for basic coders, its a packaged source, which means u need at least some normal (NOT BASIC) knowledge of how a server works
also hyperion is a very horrible source to use, sure ppl say its good, but the mina framework in it causes so much jvm usage that it does so much harm to your computer (in my opinion)

but from what i recall from looking at it…

look at
bin -> model -> players (i think, i haven’t looked at the source in a long time, but that’s usually wat packaged servers have it set to)

Read full topic
